subject: Re: [junit] running junit test case packaged in a jar

messageBody:
Arpit,

There is not a built-in way to do what you want. You can:

1) Create a Suite class that references all of the test classes you want to run.
2) Use something like http://johanneslink.net/projects/cpsuite.jsp
3) Use ant

There's a feature request for including this in core junit:

https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues/37

Good luck,

David Saff

On Mon, Mar 28, 2011 at 8:17 AM, arpit_sakhi <arpit_sakhi@...> wrote:
> I want to execute all my junit test cases which are packaged in a jar file. Is that possible to run this jar from command prompt by some command like
>
> java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore -jar allTests.jar
>
> What is the correct way to execute this?
>
> If it is possible to execute then would i need some changes in manifest file for specifying the test class (like main class in java)
>
